template.description: Match the beginning of the line
template.name: regex ^

template.name: regex $

template.description: Match at least n but not more than m times
template.name: regex {n,m}

template.description: Match at least n but not more than m times
template.name: regex {n,m}?

template.description: Match P, named property. Use p{Prop} for longer names.
template.name: regex \pP

template.description: Match eXtended Unicode "combining character sequence", equivalent to C<(?:PMpM*)>
template.name: regex \X

template.description: Match a single C char (octet) even under utf8.
template.name: regex \C

template.description: Any alphanumeric, that is, an alpha or a digit.
template.name: regex [:alnum:]

template.description: Any letter. (That's a lot more letters than you think, unless you're thinking Unicode, in which case it's still a lot.)
template.name: regex [:alpha:]

template.name: regex [:ascii:]

template.name: regex [:digit:]

template.description: Any alphanumeric or punctuation character.Any alphanumeric or punctuation character.
template.name: regex [:graph:]

template.description: Any alphanumeric or punctuation character or space.
template.name: regex [:print:]

template.name: regex [:space:]

template.description: Any identifier character, either an alnum or underline.
template.name: regex [:word:]

template.name: regex [:xdigit:]

template.description: Match only at beginning of string
template.name: regex \A

template.description: Match only at end of string, or before newline at the end
template.name: regex \Z

template.description: Match only at end of string
template.name: regex \z

template.description: Match only at pos() (e.g. at the end-of-match position of prior m//g)
template.name: regex \G

template.description: Alteration; matches either pattern1 or pattern2
template.name: regex (pattern1|pattern2)

template.description: This is for clustering, not capturing; it groups subexpressions like "()", but doesn't make backreferences as "()" does.
template.name: regex (?:pattern)

template.description: This is for clustering, not capturing; it groups subexpressions like "()", but doesn't make backreferences as "()" does.
template.name: regex (?imsx-imsx:pattern)

template.description: A comment. The text is ignored.
template.name: regex (?#text)

template.description: This zero-width assertion evaluate any embedded Perl code.
template.name: regex (?{code })

template.description: This is a "postponed" regular subexpression. The code is evaluated at run time, at the moment this subexpression may match.
template.name: regex (??{code })

template.description: One or more embedded pattern-match modifiers.
template.name: regex (?imsx-imsx)
